narratives.question_text: How clearly did the instructor define the topic of study?
comments: Very wide topic but we covered as much about sound engineering as I think you possibly could in a semester

narratives.question_text: How clearly did the instructor outline the expectation for the course, classroom activity and homework?
How well were individual class sessions prepared and presented?
How well did lectures fit within the boundaries of the course?

comments: We had just the right amount and topics for in-semester assignments to be able to manage the beastly final assignment.

narratives.question_text: How available was the instructor for help outside the classroom?
How useful were assignments in furthering an understanding of the topic?
comments: Some of the more technical stuff I was pretty confused on, like the calculating SPL and where to place speakers. Perhaps having answers to our in class worksheets (not homework but the lectures in class) somewhere online would be helpful!

narratives.question_text: If tests were given, how fairly did they measure knowledge gained?
How useful was this course in preparing you for production work?
comments: Very much geared towards how we engineer sound for live performances at YSD.

narratives.question_text: How would you evaluate the instructor's knowledge of the material?
Please offer additional comments on such topics as: what worked best about the course, suggested improvements, class materials, etc.
comments: Loved this class! Mike is a genuinely kind and great guy and is always willing to email, meet with us in person, and go over work even a thousand times over until we understand. I really appreciated his collegiality and helpfulness. I am very grateful I was able to take this course and can't wait to use this information practically in my life. This was so awesome!! Mike is awesome! One of the best and most practical classes I've taken at Yale hands down.
